meanings.definition: To calculate the total of a part of a larger amount.
meanings.sent1: I subtotalled the cost of the groceries before adding taxes.
meanings.sent2: She always subtotalled her expenses before making a budget.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel subtotalled the nuts in its stash before winter.
meanings.sent4: The detective subtotalled the clues to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to subtotal the number of pencils in the jar.

meanings.definition: To add up the individual amounts to get a total.
meanings.sent1: He carefully subtotalled the prices of the items in his cart.
meanings.sent2: They subtotalled the scores to determine the winner of the game.
meanings.sent3: The robot subtotalled the bolts and nuts for assembly.
meanings.sent4: The chef subtotalled the ingredients for the recipe.
meanings.sent5: The cashier quickly subtotalled the items at the checkout counter.
